title: 110_s546
content: SECTION 1. ADDITIONAL AMOUNTS TO ADDRESS SCHIP FUNDING SHORTFALLS FOR FISCAL YEAR 2007. Section 2104(h) of the Social Security Act is amended to include special rules for additional redistribution of funds. The Secretary shall apply special rules for additional redistribution of funds to address fiscal year 2007 funding shortfalls after April 30, 2007. This includes substituting dates and adjusting allotments for expenditure. The Secretary shall apply special rules for additional redistribution of funds to address fiscal year 2007 funding shortfalls after April 30, 2007. This includes adjusting allotments for expenditure by the State on or after April 1, 2007, without regard to certain clauses. The Secretary shall redistribute unexpended 2006 allotments by adjusting fiscal year 2006 and fiscal year 2008 expenditures. The Secretary will adjust fiscal year 2006 and fiscal year 2008 expenditures by redistributing unexpended 2006 allotments. In 2007, certain paragraphs will have amendments regarding dates and applicable amounts for eliminating estimated shortfalls in all States. The text discusses adjustments to fiscal year 2006 and 2008 expenditures by redistributing unexpended 2006 allotments. It also mentions amendments to paragraphs in 2007 to address estimated shortfalls in all States. Amendments are made to paragraphs in 2007 to address estimated shortfalls in all States. Additional conforming amendments are also mentioned in Section 2104(h).
